page.title: 08FARMING IN CALLANDER
page.content: There are 7 farms in this area.Most of the farms grow crops.They grow hay barley and silage for feeding the cattle in winter.The farms are small but most have been combined to form larger working units.All the farms rear{catle and sheep.}The sheep are Blackface,Cross Suffolk or Cross Leicester.Cross lambs fatten and are sold in June.The main breed of cattle is Cross Aberdeen Angus and Charolois good beef cattle. {Trees}are grown on the high ground and they are more profitable than sheep. Much of the hill land has been improved by draining reseeding,sowing fertilising and killing bracken. As well as the usual tractors and other equipment,farmers use combine harvesters to harvest the barley. The best barley goes for malting.
